docs.lead_paragraph: For many high school seniors and their parents, this is the season for tackling the Free Application for Federal Student Aid, a notoriously cumbersome process that the government is trying to streamline this year.

headline.main: Part 5: Answers on the Fafsa and Financial Aid

docs.lead_paragraph: ELYRIA, Ohio - Conceding his health care overhaul had run into "a little bit of a buzz saw,'' President Obama vowed on Friday to keep fighting for legislation that will "hold the insurance industry accountable" and "to bring more stability and security to folks who are in our health care system.''

headline.main: In Ohio, Obama Vows to Keep Fighting on Health Care

docs.lead_paragraph: Forty-seven health policy experts sent a letter (PDF) Friday to the House speaker, Nancy Pelosi, and the chairmen of three crucial House committees urging the House to adopt the Senate's health care legislation.

headline.main: Policy Experts Urge House to Pass Senate Bill

docs.abstract: Forty-seven health policy experts call on the House to pass the Senate bill.

docs.lead_paragraph: With the possible collapse of the Congressional health care effort, health insurers might seem to have reason to celebrate. The legislation threatened to remake much of their business, with the prospect of burdensome government regulation and less profit from selling coverage to individuals and small businesses.

headline.main: If Health Care Bills Fail, a Quandary for Insurers

docs.abstract: While the possible collapse of the Congressional health care effort might seem positive for health insurers, more of the same might not actually be such good news.
docs.snippet: While the possible collapse of the Congressional health care effort might seem positive for health insurers, more of the same might not actually be such good news.

docs.lead_paragraph: The tougher approach to financial regulation that President Obama outlined on Thursday reflected a changed political climate, the rebound in big banks' fortunes after their taxpayer bailout and a shift in power within the administration away from those who had been seen as most sympathetic to Wall Street.

headline.main: With Tougher Stance, Obama Takes On Banks
